Another month, another great @code release ðŸ‘ŒðŸ”¥ðŸŽ‰ https://t.co/cUHIlxK4XW
Anyone who has played with @runkitdev Endpoint? Looks like a neat way to write simple server-less API. https://t.co/fQ5IWfVPfk
@kylealden @marypcbuk Will sure do, looks like 3rd apps such as https://t.co/AOg5g7WyYy, can help here. Now back to work </rant> ;)
@kylealden @marypcbuk And that's a challenge all products have. Maybe I'm just not a Windows user, and so be it.
@kylealden @marypcbuk Yup, for differentiating features. Basic swipes etc are the same! Right-clicking is table stakes on desktop.
@marypcbuk @kylealden Targeting a diverse base is always challenging. Windows isn't wining me over until *my* basic expectations are meet.
@dstorey @kylealden @anatudor To be it's like driving a car. The basics should be similar regardless of where you started driving.
@marypcbuk @kylealden This isn't a hardware thing, but purely software and a holistic integration of trackpad gestures, etc.
@kylealden @marypcbuk Of-course! But basic expectations like trackpad should be meet, just like with other platforms such as Android/iOS.
@kylealden For the Surface segment I think it should. Same segment. Basics should be identical with differentiation (touch) on top.
@kylealden Indeed I am, but Windows/Surface has to work out of the box for the Macbook segment if they wanna *win* then over.
@kylealden ... which apparently is how I right-click on my Mac, and something I never thought about until trying it on Windows.
@kylealden You can configure two finger click to do right-click, but not 2 finger + touch/tap (essentially 3 finger).
@kylealden @anatudor @dstorey Well that's the thing. If I need "training" to use the trackpad, the product has failed.
@kylealden @anatudor @dstorey Example: 2 finger touch + click => right click on Mac. In Windows = nothing. Can't figure this.
@dstorey I agree. Touch is much more natural and a big win for Windows/Surface. But as a Mac user the Trackpad is root to frustration.
@kylealden @anatudor @dstorey There's something about the precision & delay which is different. Hard to describe, but damn frustrating.
@kylealden @anatudor @dstorey I think it is. I've had issues with all Windows laptops when coming from a Mac.
@kylealden @dstorey @gregwhitworth General experience from trackpad: Gestures not well integrated and precision is very flaky.
@anatudor @dstorey 1) Accidental pinch-to-zoom when scrolling. 2) Not being able move cursor in a straight line without jumpiness.
@cem2ran Yeah, moved timey to a new server this weekend, and something went wrong with the Angular+browserify bundeling. On this weeks todo!
@dstorey Coming from a Macbook, the trackpad experience is frustrating. Gestures aren't well integrated. It's all the little things.
I'm still finding it ironic that Touch works better than the TrackPad on Surface Book's. You can recognize Windows users by the mouse.
@tomdale Would you pay money for such service? BrowserStack, SauceLabs?
@jlongster Indeed. All credits goes to @gauravseth (co-author of paper) and the @chakraCore team. So much more to do for JS debuggers!
@cramforce @jlongster Shipping time travel debugging in a browser context complicates things: Reverse DOM mutations, network, etc.
@jlongster Yup, and we are already shipping reverse-stepping for Node-Chakra in @code. Read more here https://t.co/921vy4pXjn
@nolanlawson ... yeah as long as it lasts. My apartment is getting packed on Saturday :/

@joantune What if the alternative "the web platform" will be binary blobs served over HTTP? That's the real competitor.
@tjalve Nope portable Seagate. Too many bumps in the backpack I guess. Recovery time it is!
Great, my 2TB harddrive with all my photos from Asia has platter degradation, and needs expensive recovery ðŸ˜³
@jcsrb @dstorey The business model of the web is a separate discussion I'm simply looking at resources, and innovation.
@AutomatedTester Why did Opera, Samsung and Brave chose to use Chromium over rolling their own? Engines are slowly table-stakes commodity.
@dstorey I fear we, "the web", are spreading ourselves too thin with multiple engines. There's no "gecko android" or "edge ios".
@AutomatedTester The combined multi company resources put into it? How much does the plural implementations matter in todays landscape?
Would it be better for the web to unify it's resources into one engine/project in order to stay competitive to native platforms?

@gregwhitworth @thebeebs If the *solution* for Windows is to allow force reboot, there's a deeper issue that needs to get solved.
@gregwhitworth @thebeebs This about enterprise design and legacy solutions to the problem. My phone (iOS/Android) doesn't force reboot.
@thebeebs davidj_dk It's sure a Windows product decision to allow such policies to be enforceable. Flawed UX. https://t.co/UxZ1vNlj9R
@nojvek To me it's a product flaw to allow 3rd party tools (such as MSIT) to enforce such crappy last century user experience.
